# HTMLCanvasElement

**Class**

A canvas is an HTML element that defines a runtime drawing region within your web content. You can access the canvas as a JavaScript object and obtain a drawing context from it, in the form of a `CanvasRenderingContext2D` object. You draw on the canvas by using the JavaScript methods of the [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/webkitjs/canvasrenderingcontext2d] class.

## Declaration

```swift
interface HTMLCanvasElement
```

## Overview



## Setting Canvas Dimensions

- **width**: An integer containing the width of the canvas in CSS pixels.
- **height**: An integer containing the height of the canvas in CSS pixels.

## Obtaining a Context

- **getContext**: Returns the drawing context for the canvas.

## Getting an Image

- **toDataURL**: Returns a data URL containing an image of the canvas.
